author: glaxas
title: Catalyst Circle Treasury Management
description: Catalyst Circle needs to pay operating costs and Circle members for duties performed. Transactions need to be documented and managed.

f6_assessments.q0: Due to Fund7 not having a Catalyst-specific challenge, I agree that this proposal is addressing the challenge. In my understanding of the proposal, it is not about widening our community, but to increase the longevity and efficiency of Project Catalyst. With a specific focus on handling the economic side of the Catalyst Circle. The proposal does adress a very important aspect/problem, and provides a potential long term solution by creating a system that will make handling of the Cardano Circles "Treasury" more easily manageable and transparent. Both for current generations of the Catalyst Circle, and future ones. The solution that the proposal suggests is a long term one, which speaks of understanding the Catalyst "machinery" as a whole and with hopes of optimizing efficiency for everyone involved.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal presents the core team which does seem to have experience within the Cardano Community, even though the current team has no funded proposals behind them. They do seem to be active in finalizing a funded proposal from Fund6, but here it would be helpful with some links or further "proof" that the actual team will be involved. Currently, LinkedIn profiles are provided, but one of them doesn't work and the rest doesn't speak for the experience in accounting and business operations. Had the proposal included these, the team would be presented in a lot more credible and clear way.  I am by no means an accountant, but from my experience in managing organizations and communities, I do know the importance of having experts working on the economical side of things. The proposals suggestions to how to manage the Cardano Circle Treasury is presented in a very clear way, step by step. Since the proposal is focusing on a shorter timeframe (3 months), the budget allocation seems reasonable only asking for roughly 5% of the total challenge budget. The budget allocation also includes estimated work hours and distribution of resources, which further increase the credibility of the proposal. I agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap is very clear and spans over a course of 3 months, basically until next fund(8). In order to make it even clearer, I would have liked to see estimated timeframes on all of the milestones, since the only timeframe provided is the first one (12 Dec-2021). The team promises to have the created system as open source, which is a wonderful way of increasing the transparency of the project. How will the community be able to follow the development, apart from through GitHub? It is somewhat complex to find more "open" measurements of success since it is created for a very small and specialized part of the community, but how about sharing the progress of testing the system or development updates via social media channels or TownHall etc? Also worth mentioning is that the team for this proposal might change with the next fund, if I understood the proposal correctly. That means transparency is of utmost importance if the developing team is meant to change throughout different stages. I might have misinterpreted the proposal, but maybe the proposal could present the long term plans in a more clear way? Perhaps include a less detailed vision-plan for upcoming funds (8-9) to invite the community to take part of the long term plan. Lastly, I would have liked to see a short section where the team describes few of the challenges or risks that might appear during the development phase, and how they plan to deal with those. Perspective will always be important in any situation, and hat would lead me as a community member to have even more faith in the proposal. I neither agree or disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a proposal related to supporting accounting, spending, compensation, salary... tools on the cardano platform. An essential support tool for any company or workgroup that wants financial transparency, financial organization in a more methodical, professional and automatic way.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is practical and highly feasible, but it is necessary to specify more clearly how to deploy it to the market to serve the majority of the community, as well as the relevant experience of the working team.
f6_assessments.q2: In the proposal, it was mentioned that the code is completely public on github, so the community can check the project progress as well as the implementation progress of this project.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about building a system that makes CC operations frictionless and auditable when it comes to resource allocation. This is a great and meaningful idea. As we know, the Catalyst Circle plays an important role the Cardano's Governance as a whole. The problem convinces me, and is clearly described, and explained in detail. The solution is clearly defined showing a potential impact on the Cardano ecosystem in long term. Therefore, I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge, and can rate it with a score of 5

Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 3
f6_assessments.q2:

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the issue of  managing the Treasury fund's financial operations and obligations in a simple and clear manner. . They state that by developing and implementing a treasury management system they can help ensure that money provided by Catalyst is spent in a manner that is auditable and transparent. This seems to be something that will definitely support the Cardano/Catalyst ecosystem. This is very important, and therefore I rate this proposal 5 for impact.
f6_assessments.q1: The team members are experienced in business and accounting and links are provided for their LinkedIn accounts. The budget is broken down and understandable. They have requested $400 to build the accounting system from scratch. I don't know if this will be enough, but they do mention that they might need additional funds in future. They have set out a plan with actionable tasks and a timeline and it seems realistic to me. The are already busy testing the solution and mentions that it is going well.
f6_assessments.q2: The Proposer mentions that the "system that is being built will be open source and available for the community to use elsewhere.  The onboarding documentation for future treasurers will be public as well as part of the CC github Playbook". This ensures that the progress of the project can be followed and makes the project auditable. The KPI's given makes sense and will also provide the community a way to track how the project is going. Maybe provide a space where the community can already now start tracking progress.
